abstract: The state of California got the cold shoulder last month when it asked banks to continue cashing its I.O.U.s. Now, JPMorgan has agreed to lend California $1.5 billion as part of state controller John Chiang’s plan to begin redeeming the chits.
snippet: The state of California got the cold shoulder last month when it asked banks to continue cashing its I.O.U.s. Now, JPMorgan has agreed to lend California $1.5 billion as part of state controller John Chiang’s plan to begin redeeming the chits.
lead_paragraph: Turning the tables on recent events, an investment bank is coming to the government’s rescue, The Los Angeles Times reported. The government in question is that of the state of California which got the cold shoulder last month when it asked banks to continue cashing its I.O.U.s.
